title.rendered: Wing Chun martial arts, FL Kung Fu Lakeland

content.rendered:
Wing Chun martial arts, fl kung fu lakeland

(this article can not be copied or used on any other site, permission only to share link) A mind and body filled with purpose… This applies to every aspect of the martial artist.  A mind and body filled with purpose, finds purpose in every aspect of life.  From doing good to others as it calms the mind and spirit, to finding purpose in training specific moves and techniques because it brings about a better understanding, benefit, and uplifting joy.  At Sifu Och’s Wing Chun fl kung fu lakeland our goal is a mind a body filled with purpose, a martial artists life of direction and discipline.

It allows the practitioner to eliminate those movements that claim to have purpose but are superficially grounded.  A trained practitioner in street  realistic combat application can see the openings and weaknesses in new and old world viewed moves and  techniques.  A purpose filled mind looks for what works and eliminates what doesn’t.Masters and Grandmaster’s from all over have influenced my fighting application of Wing Chun Kung Fu, (fl kung fu lakeland).

This is not to say that just because you cannot get a technique down within 5 minutes of practicing it, a practitioner should dismiss it.  Rather a practitioner, even if unable to use the technique once shown can calculate the odds of its success, render viable applications and scenarios where applicable and deduce the viable use of this new information in street survival.Masters and Grandmaster’s from all over have influenced my fighting application of Wing Chun Kung Fu, (fl kung fu lakeland).

Every technique that runs through a Wing Chun practitioner’s arsenal must stick to certain principles to be used as part of their repertoire.  To decipher what works and what doesn’t, when my students come across a martial art practitioner I tell them always to ask themselves the following questions. “Does it throw the opponent off mentally and physically?” “Does it go directly from your closest weapon to their closest vital?” “Can it be applied while minimizing your opponent’s ability to counter?” “Does it take your opponent doing a specific move or can you use it at anytime?” “Is it quick, causing pain, breaks, tears, knockout, or damage immediately?” “Does it make use of the entire body as a simultaneous offensive and defensive weapon?” “Does it require both your hands to accomplish or is one free to attack and the other defend?” “Can it be done universally by any gender, age and weight class without using strength versus strength?” “Does it train reaction, or does it have to be executed with a medium to high level of conscious application?” “Does it take more than  two moves to accomplish your intended goal while causing pain, breaks or tears?”Masters and Grandmaster’s from all over have influenced my fighting application of Wing Chun Kung Fu, (fl kung fu lakeland).

These are a few examples.  But many techniques that do not fall under these principles and are dismissed from the Wing Chun kung fu in lakeland fl mind set and fighting application.   This is not to say that the techniques used by this or any other style are not effective for combat but rather they are not effectively integrated into the Wing Chun fighting mind frame, structure and principles.   A master practitioner of Wing Chun can quickly dismiss or affirm their own reactionary responses by using the rules and principles set forth by Wing Chun kung fu in lakeland fl.Hopefully these articles leave you with questions about my style of Wing Chun fl kung fu lakeland.

These rules and principles don’t make a practitioner dogmatic by following them but rather one that can expand and become more effective.  It keeps the practitioner constantly thinking for the street and only what works versus what looks good.  This maximizes the practitioner’s training time, by not wasting it on theoretical possibilities or fancy ego boosting applications.Masters and Grandmaster’s from all over have influenced my fighting application of Wing Chun Kung Fu, (fl kung fu lakeland).

A purpose filled mind is a mind that thinks for itself, but still gives respect and honor to the individuals responsible for the knowledge and skill they have attained.  A purpose filled mind is a mind of respectful openness to outside stimulus and is extremely thankful when it comes across information that is not fake or fancy and is effective and quick.  You also have an unshakeable resolve to drop your opponent instantaneously.  Your mind and body are purpose driven on the survival of you and your loved ones.Masters and Grandmaster’s from all over have influenced my fighting application of Wing Chun Kung Fu, (fl kung fu lakeland).

There are many Wing Chun principles. Perhaps the most obvious is keeping it simple.  The less complex your movements and techniques are the more direct and the probability of connection increases.  An opponent pulls you and instead of resisting you move in with the energy striking directly while using the opponent’s pull as additional force.  Instead of kicking to the head which may take six to eight feet from the back leg, a Wing Chun kung fu in lakeland fl practitioner will instead use the front leg to strike the opponent’s knee.  This kick to the opponent’s knee is only a three to four foot distance and has all of their current weight being twisted upon it.  A Wing Chun practitioner is not taught to turn the body away from the assailant to make them a smaller target.  Instead they are taught that this pulls fifty percent of their defense away from the attack at hand.  If the assailant was to trap the side closest to them, when closing the gap, the other side would not be able to provide a simple or direct response.  All of Wing Chun’s combinations should flow together to form a “chain” of high and low blasting attacks on the centerline.  These are all things that make this art so different and unique.  They are not attacks on other styles and how they best perform and teach their practitioners but rather a comparison to show what is so unique about every style.Masters and Grandmaster’s from all over have influenced my fighting application of Wing Chun Kung Fu, (fl kung fu lakeland).
Hopefully these articles leave you with questions about my style of Wing Chun fl kung fu lakeland.  The answers and perspectives come from years of training and travels all over the world.  Masters and Grandmaster’s from all over have influenced my fighting application of Wing Chun Kung Fu, (fl kung fu lakeland). Though Sifu Och Wing Chun and the articles I have here are a brief anthology of my experience and thoughts. Meet with me, come down to the school, let have lunch if its available as there is so much more I can show and teach you in person. Come and visit our Wing Chun kung fu self defense and Ip Man school in lakeland, fl. I would love to continue this discussion and thank you for your reading.At Sifu Och’s Wing Chun fl kung fu lakeland our objective is a brain a body loaded with reason, a military specialists life of bearing and control.

Sifu Justin Och – Wing Chun fl kung fu lakeland

address; 116 east pine street, Lakeland Florida

ph;  863.800.0171

website – https://sifuochwingchun.com you can reach me on

Facebook at; http://www.facebook.com/sifuoch

our group page; http://www.facebook.com/sifuoch#!/groups/SifuOchLakelandWingChun/

twitter – https://twitter.com/sifuochwingchun
